head.supplied: ¶ [From Baron von Mueller, Melbourne, stating that the Government of India was desirous, through the office of the Hon. the Premier of Victoria, of obtaining a large quantity of marum grass seed, and...

div.p: To the Port Fairy Borough Council

Letter not found. The text given here is from Port Fairy gazette,, 17 January 1896, p. 3.
The receipt of the letter was recorded in Minute book 11, p. 191, 15 January 1896, Borough Council records, Port Fairy, as ' Correspondence inward.
' Baron von Mueller Re Marram Grass Seed for Government of India Seed to be forwarded in due time'.
[From Baron von Mueller, Melbourne, stating that the Government of India was desirous, through the office of the Hon. the Premier of Victoria, of obtaining a large quantity of marum grass seed, and as that sent from Port Fairy last year gave good results, he requested that the council would kindly let him know whether they could supply the required seed, the cost of gathering which would be refunded. Some more seeds of economic plants would be shortly sent to the council. — The Town Clerk intimated that he had received the seeds referred to, and had handed them to the Ranger. — Seed to be forwarded when ripe, in about three weeks' time.]
